entry.title: From Skill to Agent: Building a Legal Payment-Solicitation Letter with Joule Studio
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning on a Joule Studio experimental environment. The final version that will be released may provide a different set of capabilities.

Introduction

Finance teams spend valuable time preparing formal demand letters: finding the correct legal recipient, composing language that satisfies local legal requirements, and ensuring consistent formatting. Joule Studio (part of SAP Build) lets you automate these steps using modular Skills and orchestrating Agents ‚Äî while preserving governance and auditability.

This article walks through a complete pattern: configure secure connectivity to S/4HANA, build the Get Customer Information Skill, then compose the Credit Collection Specialis that generates language-specific legal letters ready for review and sending.

Quick definitions

Joule Skill

A focused, reusable function with defined inputs and outputs. Example: retrieve a customer‚Äôs legal name and address from S/4HANA.

Joule Agent

An intelligent orchestrator that invokes Skills, makes decisions, handles user interactions, and produces business outcomes (for example: draft a legal letter, request approval, send the letter, and log the result).

Use case: Legal payment-solicitation letter

Goal: allow a collections specialist to enter a customer number, debt amount and language ‚Äî and receive a legally formatted demand letter populated with S/4HANA legal data.

Inputs: customer_number, debt_amount, language
Outputs: Draft legal letter (text format).

We will build:

  • Skill: CustomerLegalDataFetcher ‚Äî fetches legal name & address from S/4HANA.
  • Agent: PaymentSolicitationAgent ‚Äî orchestrates retrieval and generates the letter text in the selected language.

Step 0 ‚Äî Configure secure connectivity (BTP Destination & Action Project)

Before the Skill can call S/4HANA, set up a Destination in BTP and an Action Project in SAP Build to expose the needed API in a governed way.

Create a Destination in SAP BTP Cockpit

  1. Log in to SAP BTP cockpit ‚Üí Subaccount ‚Üí Connectivity ‚Üí Destinations ‚Üí New Destination.
  2. Name: S4HANA_BP. Type: HTTP. URL: your S/4HANA API base (e.g. https://.../sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER).
  3. Proxy Type: Internet (or OnPremise if using Cloud Connector). Select Authentication (OAuth2ClientCredentials or BasicAuth) and provide credentials or client info.
  4. Optional properties: sap-client, HTML5.DynamicDestination=true, WebIDEEnabled=true,sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled=treu,sap.processautomation.enabled=true. Save and Check Connection.

Create an Action Project in SAP Build

  1. Open SAP Build, move to Actions window (selecting it on the left hand side menu) and click on the Create button. 
  2. Go to API Specification and select SAP Business Accelerator Hub.  Here you can find the Business Partner (A2X) API specification.  Select it and click on Next button.  Assign a name to the project: S4HANA_Customer_Actions Connections and provide a description. Click on Create button.
  3. Select the API calls to be added to the project. For the purpose of this implementation, you can select Retrieves customer general data and Retrieves business partner address data.  
  4. After adding them to the project, the Action editing GUI appears, providing  the ability to fine tune the inputs and the outputs of your actions.
  5. You can test the Actions selecting the name of the destination you created before. After finalizing the Actions, you need to Release and Publish the project.

Result: your Action is published and available to be called from a Joule Skill.

Step 1 ‚Äî Build the Skill: Credit Collection Letter

A. Create the Skill project

  1. From the SAP Build Lobby,  Create  ‚Üí Joule Skill ‚Üí Name: Credit Collection Letter. 
  2. Now, from the Joule Studio main page: Create  ‚Üí Joule Skill ‚Üí Name: Get Customer Information
  3.  Assign a meaningful description, such as: A skill to retrieve Customer information from a S/4HANA system, providing as input the Customer Number.
  4. Define the input parameter of the skill (CustomerNumber) and the output parameters (CustomerLegalName, streetName, houseNumber, cityName, postalCode and country).

B. Call the Action

  1. Add two Call Action step ‚Üí choose S4HANA_Customer_Actions and the customer and address lookup actions.
  2. Map inputs/outputs between Skill and Action. 
  3. In the End step, map the output of the Action calls to the skill's output parameters.

C. Test the Skill

Before testing the skill, you need to create an environment and to associate the destination to this environment:

  1. From the SAP Build Lobby,  open the Control Tower from the menu on the left hand side.
  2. Open the Environments page. You can find it in the Tenant Configuration section. 
  3. Click on the Activate Private Environment button. 
  4. Go back to the Control Tower and open the Destinations page. You can find it in the Backend Configuration section.
  5. Find the destination you defined in the BTP Cockpit, open the Actions menu on the right side and select Associate Environments.
  6. Now you can associate the destination to the private environment you activated in step #3.

Once the environment has been created, with an associated destination, from the Skill editing page you can test the skill clicking on the Test button. Select your private environment and the destination. The Joule prompting page is displayed and you can send some prompts to test the Skill. 

 

 

Step 2 ‚Äî Build the Agent: Credit Collection Specialist

A. Create the Agent

  1. From the Joule Studio main page: Create  ‚Üí Joule Agent ‚Üí Name: Credit Collection Specialist
  2. Add a description, such as: Writer of reminder letters for unpaid debts
  3. Now in the Agent Builder page, you need to fill the Expertise, the Instructions and the Additional Context text boxes. Tip #1: in the instructions, please specify that the Get Customer Information skill should be used for retrieving the customer's information. Tip #2: Provide an example of the letter you want it writes.
  4. Chose the LLM model to be used, selecting between the available ones.
  5. In the Tools section, add the Get Customer Information skill as a tool to be used.

‚ÄÉ

B. Attach Tools

  • In the Tools section, add the Get Customer Information skill as a tool to be used.

C. Test and Deploy the Agent

  1. Save the Agent and click on the Test button. Select your private environment and the destination.
  2. The Joule prompting page is displayed and you can send some prompts to test the Agent. 
  3. Once the Agent is fully debugged, you can Release and Deploy the project to one of the environments available. If necessary, you can create a new environment from the Control Tower.

Security, governance & integration notes

Use service credentials or OAuth client credentials for the Destination. Limit Destination editing to admins, and ensure Cloud Connector is configured if S/4HANA is on-premise. Maintain a clear change-control process for legal templates ‚Äî any change must trigger regression tests of the Agent.

Conclusion & call to action

By separating retrieval (Skill) from orchestration (Agent), you make the solution reusable, testable and governable. Users simply provide the customer number, amount and language ‚Äî Joule handles the rest, identifying the Agent and the Skill to be used: fetch data and generate compliant letter text that can be cut and pasted into a Word document.

And that‚Äôs all for today! Now you can continue reading other posts on the SAP Community Blogs: https://community.sap.com/t5/all-sap-community-blogs/ct-p/all-blogs

entry.title: How TheValueChain transforms multitenant solutions with Q&A Joule Agent Built in Joule Studio
entry.content:
A quick introduction to TheValueChain

TheValueChain is an SAP Partner founded in 2011 and has over 400 consultants across Belgium, The Netherlands, Switzerland, Luxembourg and France. Over the years, TheValueChain has primarily been active in providing consulting services (end-to-end projects, SLA's, ad-hoc assignments). Since a few years we have adapted our strategy to also provide our own in-house developed products, built on top of SAP Business Technology Platform with a primary focus on multitenant (SaaS) solutions.

Today, I'm the lead technical architect for the multitenant solutions, ensuring our solutions are built using the latest SAP best-practices, are scalable, resilient and stable. We currently have 3 multitenant solutions live in the SAP Store, GoBeyond Supplier Invoicing (which is SAP Business AI certified!), GoBeyond Integration Monitoring and GoBeyond Customer Portal.

Providing instant access to our solution documentation

We are strong believers in leveraging AI in all our solutions to improve process efficiency & user experience. With our solutions already being AI-infused using SAP Business AI services like SAP AI Core and SAP Document AI, mainly focusing on process efficiency. A next logical step was to focus on AI-assisted user experience.

We wanted to start with enriching the user experience of our GoBeyond Supplier Invoicing solution, by creating two Joule Agents. Our primary use-case being a Q&A agent, which, based on document grounding our online notion documentation website can answer any general or how-to questions a user could have about our solution.

Why did we see the Q&A agent as our primary use-case? The answer is easy, even though we have a full-blown documentation website we still see support tickets being logged with general questions, even with a well-maintained website, critical answers get buried among large volumes of content, leading to increased support ticket submissions seeking answers to general questions. That demonstrated the need to surface precise, contextual information instantly, reducing support workload. and improving user experience.

So, the advantage of our Q&A agent is twofold, our customers get instant answers to their questions by simply asking Joule instead of logging a support ticket and we from a support perspective get less tickets, freeing up our time to focus on what really matters: constantly improving and including new innovations in our solutions.

Joule Agent answering a general question about one of our apps in the Supplier Invoice Management Solution

How we created and deployed a Q&A agent in a matter of hours

For our Q&A agent, we are leveraging four main components:

  • Notion (which holds our live documentation)
  • GitHub actions (as a data ingestion pipeline)
  • SAP Core AI
  • Joule Studio

The idea behind this setup is that whenever we release new features or bugfixes to production, a GitHub action automatically crunches our online documentation, updating the vector storage in SAP AI Core with the latest documentation. (we can manually trigger this pipeline, if we improve documentation based on user feedback without an actual release)

GitHub Action as a data ingestion pipeline

Under the hood of our data ingestion pipeline, we are leveraging a custom script that uses the SAP Cloud SDK for AI to fill a data repository in a document grounding-enabled resource group in SAP Core AI. Since this is a full custom scenario as we can't link e.g. an S3 Object Store, we are also in charge of properly applying document chunking to get the best results and not overload the AI Agents with unnecessary context. 

For chunking the documents, we leveraged LangChain's RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter in markdown mode (with a maximum chunk size of 10K tokens and an overlap of 1K tokens).

Data repository view in SAP Core AI, showing the chunked documentation

In a last step, we assigned our SAP Core AI resource group to our Joule Agent as tool, providing clear instructions on how and when to use this tool.

Joule Studio Agent Builder, documentation tool maintenance

For informational purposes, the full solution architecture looks like:

Supplier Invoice Management Solution architecture

We are only getting started

From our point of view, the Q&A agent implementation was a big success. We are able to cover the full scope of what we had in mind for our Q&A agent. As per our estimates, this will decrease the number of documentation related support tickets by 25%.

For us, this is only the beginning, we plan to implement a Q&A agent for our other solutions as well in a first phase. In a next phase, we're planning on creating additional agents interacting with the solutions and guiding the user through the processes in an AI-assisted way, always keeping a human in the loop. 

What stood out for us in Joule Studio was that it‚Äôs very intuitive and well-integrated no-code environment, especially if you are used to working with SAP Build Process Automation, the experience is the same. Even better, you can easily re-use existing artifacts like e.g. action projects, automations and processes by integrating them in Joule Skills and assigning these skills to your agents.

Even though SAP AI Core requires some more technical knowledge, integration with Joule Studio is so easy and straight forward, your SAP AI Core data repository is assigned to your AI agent in a matter of minutes.

All-in-all we really like the experience and were able to deliver our Q&A agent in a matter of hours. We‚Äôre already looking forward to building our next use-cases!

entry.title: Beyond PoC: How sovanta Detects Purchasing Anomalies with a Custom Joule Agent built in Joule Studio
entry.content:
Agents are the future of intelligent enterprise automation. They can understand context, enhance workflows, and interact autonomously within business systems. With the new agent builder capability in Joule Studio, SAP is providing the tools to get closer to that future.

As an early adopter of Joule Studio, we at sovanta explored how it can be used to solve real-world problems with custom AI agents. For more than 15 years, sovanta has been supporting SAP customers with Extensions, Integrations, and AI solutions in the cloud, forming into a specialized SAP BTP partner.  Using this experience in SAP BTP and AI, we have successfully implemented a real-world use case with the agent builder that goes beyond a proof-of-concept.

In this blog post, we will explore this use case that we have adopted together with one of our most innovative customers Endress+Hauser: Detecting anomalies in customers‚Äô purchasing behavior.

Why we chose Agent Builder in Joule Studio

Before exploring the agent builder, we already gained hands-on experience creating Joule Skills in Joule Studio. This gave us an early glimpse into the potential of integrating AI more deeply into SAP business processes, and we were excited to take it to the next level.

When SAP introduced the agent builder, we immediately saw its potential. It provides a low-code environment that allows users to design, configure, and deploy AI agents with minimal technical effort. By combining skills, data connections, and prompt logic, it enables teams to create powerful agents that can understand business context directly within the SAP ecosystem and scale in a heterogeneous landscape efficiently.

For us, it was the perfect opportunity to explore how AI agents could become a natural part of everyday business processes. Our goal was clear: to validate whether the agent builder could support real business-critical scenarios beyond just prototypes and evaluate its potential for large-scale customer adoption. 

The Business Challenge: Identifying Anomalies in Purchasing Behavior

Together with our long-time customer Endress+Hauser, a global process and laboratory instrumentation and automation supplier, we decided to focus on a challenge faced by sales representatives: identifying anomalies in customers‚Äô purchasing behavior to be better prepared for sales meetings.

Currently, it‚Äôs almost impossible for sales representatives to quickly recognize if a customer‚Äôs purchasing patterns have changed significantly across Endress+Hauser‚Äôs extensive product portfolio. Such anomalies could include:

  • Sudden increases or decreases in a specific product area
  • Shifts towards unexpected measuring principles
  • Recent orders of products that are soon to be discontinued or put on order stop

Detecting these changes manually would require searching through multiple systems, analyzing past purchases, checking order stop lists ‚Äì a process that is extremely time-consuming and not really feasible in practice. As a result, these insights could be overlooked, leading to slower reactions in the sales process, missed opportunities, and lower customer satisfaction. This made it a perfect challenge to be solved by an agent and the ideal case for the agent builder.

Our Solution: Detecting Anomalies and More

Our idea was simple: let sales representatives interact with their data conversationally. To identify anomalies, they should be able to simply ask:

  • ‚ÄúAre there any anomalies in purchasing behavior for my customer?‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúDid my customer purchase any products recently that are running in order stop over the next year?‚Äù.

The agent would extract the needed data, detect anomalies, and provide a clear explanation.

We did not want to be limited to anomaly detection, which is why we decided to connect the agent directly to the database. This would allow users to go beyond anomaly detection and explore additional insights about customers and products. For example, instead of just identifying products running in order stop, the agent would also be able to identify successor products that should be recommended instead.

And it doesn‚Äôt stop there: by additionally connecting the agent to the product documentation, we were able to further extend its capabilities. This allows sales representatives to instantly compare the ordered product with its successor and understand what has changed.

How our Agent can detect Anomalies

To be able to answer questions to prepare for sales meetings, we identified several data sources we needed to connect:

  • BDIH ‚Äì Business Data and Integration Hub: SAP HANA Cloud containing all types of operational data, including technical details of millions of sold devices.
  • Product Knowledge Base: Contains Product Documentation that is reachable via an internal RAG System.

The exact technical setup can be seen in the architecture below:

Since we wanted the agent to handle a wide range of questions from the BDIH, we decided to implement a Text-to-SQL approach with Joule Studio. This enabled the agent to transform natural language questions into structured queries, allowing it to directly extract data from the database.

To achieve this, we created a Text-to-SQL pipeline in Joule Studio. This involved grounding the agent with the following documents:

  • The database schema of all relevant tables
  • Example SQL queries
  • General documentation about the database structure and business context

These documents were added via document grounding, allowing the agent to better understand how to map natural language questions to actual database queries.

For the actual data extraction from the BDIH, we included a custom Joule Skill that takes a SQL query as input and retrieves the corresponding data through a proxy endpoint to the database. Because SAP Build Actions currently do not fully support dynamic outputs, we applied a workaround to handle the dynamically changing query results coming from the database.

In addition to the Text-to-SQL pipeline, we also connected the Product Knowledge Base with a separate Joule Skill. With these two integrated data sources connected to the agent through separate Joule Skills, the agent can flexibly retrieve and combine relevant information depending on the type of question.

The Agent Flow and its Business Impact

The interaction flow is simple and powerful:

  1. The sales representative asks a question in natural language.
  2. The agent interprets the intent and decides which data source to use.
  3. It will extract information from the DB schema and example queries before formulating an appropriate SQL query.
  4. The query result is retrieved and enriched with additional knowledge from the Product Knowledge Base.
  5. The agent summarizes the findings in plain language and is available for follow-up questions.

The following two examples demonstrate how this flow can help find anomalies in purchasing behavior for certain measuring principles, find products in order stop and their successor products:

This conversational and data-driven approach significantly improves efficiency and empowers sales teams to prepare more effectively for customer meetings. It also allows sales representatives to identify opportunities and gaps earlier and provide recommendations for the customer, demonstrating how Joule Studio can create measurable business value.

Our Final Thoughts on Agent Builder in Joule Studio

Our experience as an early adopter has shown that the agent builder is more than just a proof-of-concept. It‚Äôs a promising addition to the SAP ecosystem, fully native to SAP Build, which allows us to leverage existing components such as actions, automations, and workflows directly within Joule Studio. It also proved to be highly open and interoperable by seamlessly connecting agents and skills with third-party systems. Combined with its built-in business understanding and grounding, it enables enterprise-ready AI Agents to reliably interact with real business data.

Looking ahead, we plan to further explore capabilities such as Agent-to-Agent collaboration and additional agent tools coming to the agent builder. For example, a native database tool could eliminate the need for our current Text-to-SQL pipeline and even further simplify the agent development process. At sovanta, we are excited to continue exploring how Joule Studio can empower our customers with AI Agents that can seamlessly and autonomously interact within their business systems.

entry.title: From Days to Minutes: How EPI-USE Labs‚Äô Custom Joule Agent Automates Payroll Variance Analysis with
entry.content:
As a global company, EPI-USE Labs provides software solutions and services to over 1,800 large enterprises worldwide, with a core focus on SAP Human Capital Management (HCM) and Payroll. We have over 40 years of experience in SAP HCM projects and are one of the world's largest independent SAP HR/Payroll specialists. Our solutions, such as Query Manager and Variance Monitor, are key to how our clients manage their SAP Payroll data.

Our expertise extends into AI and developing custom solutions for SAP and SuccessFactors. We are always looking for ways to leverage new technologies (such as Joule) to enhance the efficiency and employee experience for our clients.

Why and What?

Our specific use case was to dramatically reduce the time and effort payroll administrators and employees spend on payroll variance queries. Currently, when an employee's pay changes, the reason for the variance often requires manual investigation, leading to numerous queries, data checking in different systems and delays, that could impact employees. Days can be spent on these investigations and payroll needs to run before a specific date and time.

We are an early adopter of Joule Studio because we recognize that the future of enterprise software is intelligent, driven by agentic AI, and improving user experience. SAP's decision to embed AI and the Joule digital assistant directly into core business operations, aligns perfectly with our strategic focus.

To solve this, we set out to create a custom Joule agent using Joule Studio - AI Payroll Variance Agent.

How?

Joule Studio enabled us to deliver agents that are powered with human-like reasoning, grounded in business data, and connect disparate systems to solve complex, goal-oriented business processes and provide reliable outcomes. Payroll, which is highly complex and rule-based, is an ideal workflow for this type of agentic AI.

We built our custom Joule AI agent was designed to understand and explain complex pay discrepancies in natural language. It's a prime example of utilizing Joule skills and the agent builder capability in Joule Studio to connect disparate data systems and provide immediate, contextual answers.

The Payroll Variance Joule Agent consists of two parts:

  • Custom Joule skill creation: We leveraged our expertise with SAP Payroll data and our Query Manager solution to create Joule skills that can access real-time, live payroll results from SAP ECC On-premises Payroll or SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll. These skills were the "tools" the Joule agent could use for more rule-based, deterministic execution.
  • Custom Joule agent creation: The agent was configured in the agent builder capability of Joule Studio with the goal of "explaining payroll variances". We grounded the agent in the business context by linking it to the payroll data retrieved by our custom skills.

The agent enables payroll administrators to instantly understand the reason for pay changes, such as a decrease in regular working time, a full week absence, or the elimination of overtime, by simply asking a question. This transforms the HR administrator experience by providing the necessary context for follow-up, which ultimately streamlines operations. This capability moves beyond standard deliveries, allowing for custom SAP Payroll automation that dramatically improves transparency and cuts down on investigation time. In a POC with a client of ours, it was estimated that our Payroll Variance Agent saves them three days per Payroll Analyst, per region.

What's next? 

Our early-stage experience working with Joule Studio in SAP Build was overwhelmingly positive. The capability was very intuitive to use, allowing us to quickly develop an agent and skills solution that delivered measurable value and scaled across SAP and non-SAP systems.

We see immense value in SAP Build's environment coupled with Joule Studio's AI capabilities, which empower partners like us to bring sophisticated, business-specific solutions to market rapidly.

Looking forward, we plan on building AI Agents for more complex, multi-step scenarios that require dynamic planning and reasoning across a wider array of SAP and non-SAP systems. Our next steps will focus on integrating Joule with our own Payroll Expert Agent once A2A capabilities are available and build out several use-cases to achieve new levels of efficiency and user experience.

entry.title: Announcing New SAP Build and Service Catalog Extensions for VS Code
entry.content:
SAP is committed to ‚Äúmeeting developers where they are‚Äù and recently SAP unveiled new MCP servers for SAP Build, demonstrating SAP‚Äôs dedication to that Vision.  

By adopting these new MCP standards, developers can seamlessly extend SAP‚Äôs development capabilities into multiple development environments, ensuring flexibility and choice by enhancing popular agentic development solutions.

Now SAP is going even further, and I am happy to share that we have now released new extensions to the VS Code marketplace, marking what is sure to be just the beginning of a transformative journey.

With the expansion of SAP Build‚Äôs productivity tools available as VS Code extensions, SAP is shaping the end-to-end experience and empowering the professional developers to choose whatever tools suits them better while leveraging the power of SAP development frameworks, integrations and accelerators.

Service Catalog Extension

This extension will provide a central location for exploring and consuming services in a highly efficient and harmonious manner, enhancing both development speed and quality.  This will be the local implementation of the well-known service center found in SAP Business Application Studio. The initial release focusses on the ABAP catalog and on-premise systems, supporting basic authentication and seamless integration with Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) applications. Next year we plan to add support for exploration and consumption of Data Products from SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

Keep in mind that you must also install the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Tools extension to take advantage of CAP application integration.

SAP Build Full-Stack Extension Pack

This pack bundles all available tools for SAP Build full-stack application development. It will make it easier and faster for developers to find and install the tools they can use to enhance their end-to-end development experience. You can expect all forthcoming SAP Build Full-Stack productivity tools released by SAP, such as the Storyboard planned for release next year, to be incorporated into this pack.

SAP is investing in both, the improvement of the current onboarding experience with the full-stack pack and the release of ongoing innovation of development tools for the VS Code marketplace.

Looking ahead, SAP plans to provide seamless integration with SAP APIs and platform services, thereby optimizing the development experience for its community, and to release BTP extensions to the open VSX registry to make getting started with SAP Build development easier with other popular agentic development solutions, further enriching the diverse development ecosystem.

We are thrilled about the possibilities these new tools bring to the development community and look forward to witnessing the innovative solutions they will inspire.
Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to be at the forefront of innovation and try out our new extensions now!

entry.title: Effortless SAPUI5 Patch Management: Introducing the New SAPUI5 Runtime Repository
entry.content:
For years, the MIME repository has been the standard location for storing SAPUI5 runtime artifacts for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. In contrast, the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition retrieves SAPUI5 from the cloud CDN. Although the MIME repository has served its purpose, many customers working with SAPUI5, especially system operators installing new SAPUI5 patches, face common challenges. These include poor performance, numerous manual steps, issues with transports, and risk of inconsistent states.

The good news is that SAP introduces the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository with the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025. This modern replacement overcomes these challenges and prepares you for the next generation of SAPUI5. To ensure efficiency for all customers, downports to all maintained lower releases are available, except for SAP S/4HANA 1809 using SAPUI5 1.38. You can access this repository through SAP Notes containing transport-based correction instructions (TCIs).

Let's explore how this new repository significantly enhances your workflow.

Performance Where It Matters

  • MIME Repository: SAPUI5 patch updates can take up to 2 hours. Loading debug-sources with sap-ui-debug=true can take up to 10 minutes.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Patch upgrades are approximately 20 times faster. During runtime, loading debug sources also occurs about 20 times faster. These improvements ensure smoother operations and faster response times.

From Complexity to Simplicity

  • MIME Repository: Handles more than 70,000 individual ABAP objects. This volume poses a risk of errors and inconsistent updates.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: All runtime content is bundled into just one ABAP object. This approach guarantees consistent updates and reduces operational risks.

Automation First

  • MIME Repository: Updates rely on custom, manual procedures, which increases the maintenance effort.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Uses SAP TCI Notes and comes with an automated process specifically for SAP S/4HANA cloud operations. This makes updates easier and more reliable.

Zero Downtime Deployments

  • MIME Repository: No support for zero-downtime deployments. This limitation might cause interruptions during system upgrades.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Fully supports online deployment with zero downtime. This feature ensures that SAPUI5 content remains continuously available, even during system upgrades.

Safe, Standardized Rollbacks

  • MIME Repository: Reverting patches can be error-prone, often requiring manual fixes and risking inconsistent system states.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Reverting SAPUI5 patches is fully supported. Runtime content is delivered as a single ABAP object, and the update process integrates with TCIs. Rollbacks are straightforward, consistent, and safe. This approach simplifies the validation of new patches: if issues arise, you can reliably revert to the previous stable state without lengthy manual intervention or risking inconsistencies across systems.

Future-Proof 

  • MIME Repository: Not compatible with multiple SAPUI5 versions.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Supports multiple SAPUI5 versions in parallel, making it ready for the future while ensuring backward compatibility.

Here's an overview of all the improvements:

Why This Matters

The move from MIME Repository to the new SAPUI5 Runtime Repository isn‚Äôt just a technical upgrade ‚Äî it‚Äôs a significant step toward:

  • Faster and safer patch updates.
  • Reduced operational effort.
  • Continuous availability.
  • Future compatibility.

If your organization uses on-premise landscapes and works with SAPUI5, it's time to embrace this change: the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository becomes automatically available with the current SAP S/4HANA 2025 release and in the latest support packages of all maintained SAP S/4HANA versions except SAP S/4HANA 1809.

Even if you do not want to upgrade to a new support package, you can still use the SAPUI5 runtime repository by installing SAP Note 3599156. If you have hesitated to install a new SAPUI5 patch, now is the time to try the new procedure and benefit from its efficacy and ease. Installing the latest SAPUI5 patches ensures your applications run efficiently today and are prepared for the future.

üëâHave you performed any SAPUI5 patch upgrades recently? What has your experience been like so far? To get started, refer to SAP Note 3599156.

entry.title: How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace
entry.content:
How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace

Introduction

The modern workplace has changed dramatically. Employees no longer rely solely on static intranets or scattered collaboration tools. Instead, they expect a connected, personalized experience that helps them cut through the noise and focus on meaningful work. Enter artificial intelligence (AI).

AI isn‚Äôt just another layer of technology- it‚Äôs rapidly becoming the backbone of digital workspaces. By surfacing the right information at the right time, automating repetitive tasks, and enabling smarter collaboration and self-service, AI is redefining how we work, learn, and engage every day.

With digital workspaces in SAP Build, these AI capabilities are already available today‚Äîhelping organizations deliver intelligent, personalized employee experiences out of the box

The Rise of AI in the Digital Workspace

For years, digital workspaces have been a central hub for business applications, documents, apps, and communications in one place. Useful‚Äîbut often overwhelming. Employees spent as much time searching for information as they did, acting on it.

Now, AI is filling the gaps. With intelligent copilots, content curation, and contextual answers, digital workspaces like SAP Build Work Zone have evolved from being a destination for information into an engine for productivity and engagement.

Core AI features available today in SAP Build digital workspaces

1. Chatbots & Virtual Assistants
With Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI copilot, workspace users can access information instantly. From answering HR questions to surfacing insights from reports, employees can rely on conversational AI to get what they need instantaneously.

Joule, SAP's AI copilot integrated into the digital workspace

2. Task completion with Joule Skills

One can enhance Joule capabilities by creating skills for it in Joule Studio. Connected with SAP systems and third-party applications, Joule can complete tasks like submitting time-off requests, approving workflows, or surfacing KPI dashboards‚Äîall from a single interface

  

3. Document Grounding Capabilities
Joule ensures information is both contextual and reliable when using workspace content to ground AI responses. For example, employees can ask ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs our travel policy in Europe?‚Äù and receive an AI response sourced directly from workspace content or SAP SuccessFactors policies when it is enabled as an AI source.

  

4. Content generation and summarization using generative AI
SAP Build leverages generative AI to help users create and refine content‚Äîwhether drafting announcements, summarizing updates, or suggesting language for a blog post‚Äîdirectly within the workspace.

  

 

 

 

 

Real-Life Examples in Action

  • Information access with grounded responses

Joule responds with answers grounded in the specific workspace content. Employees can query Joule with specific questions like ‚ÄúWhat is the holiday plan for next year in Germany" or ‚Äúhow can I apply for a sabbatical leave? Point me to the relevant file‚Äù.

  • Smart document summaries

Integrated AI services capture the highlights of a workspace document‚Äîpolicy highlights, key insights from data, or high-level overview of a blog.

  • Workflow Automation

From within SAP Build workspace, an employee can ask Joule to ‚Äúcreate a purchase order‚Äù or ‚Äúshow current pipeline metrics.‚Äù The copilot triggers the workflow in connected SAP systems, making productivity seamless.

  • Intelligent content curation

Users can easily create blog posts, feed posts or even knowledge articles in the workspace using the native AI features with simple prompts like ‚Äúcreate a workspace feed reminding members to fill their timesheet in a funny and casual tone‚Äù.

The Business Impact

  • Faster Information Access: Joule makes information searches 95% faster by surfacing insights and data instantly. Grounded insights reduce time spent searching for answers.
  • Reduced Manual Effort: Generative AI-assisted summarization and content creation free up employee time.
  • Better Governance: AI responses in SAP are backed by enterprise content, ensuring compliance and accuracy.

Preparing for the AI-Powered Workspace

Adopting AI in digital workspaces is not just about flipping a switch‚Äîit‚Äôs about preparing your organization:

  • Change Management: Train employees to adopt AI workflows and copilots in their daily work.
  • Governance: Define guardrails for AI-generated content, data privacy, and security.
  • Integration: Maximize value by connecting SAP Build with existing SAP and non-SAP applications, making copilots more powerful.

Conclusion

AI is no longer a future trend; it‚Äôs already embedded in the digital workspaces employees use today. With embedded AI and Joule, organizations don‚Äôt just imagine an intelligent workspace‚Äîthey experience it

By weaving AI into daily workflows‚Äîwhether through copilots, recommended learning, or curated content‚ÄîSAP Build helps organizations unlock productivity, agility, and engagement at scale.

Ready to take the next step?

Learn more about these capabilities and their implementation from the following resources:

  1. Joule integration with Work Zone
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
  3. Set Up Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  4. Integration With Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  5. Enabling AI Features | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Join SAP Usability Testing Sessions at SAP TechEd Bangalore - Influence your Product Experience
entry.content:
Join our live usability testing session at SAP TechEd Bangalore on November 25-26, 2025.

Usability testing offers a unique opportunity for SAP users to engage directly with the SAP product and development teams. In a focused 60-minute one-on-one session, you‚Äôll interact with product screens and evaluate whether the buttons, terminology, and features meet your expectations and workflow needs.

If you've ever thought, "Why can‚Äôt I just click here and make it work?" ‚Äî this is your chance to influence exactly that. Your feedback helps us create intuitive, user-friendly solutions that better support your business.

Prerequisites for participating in usability testing at SAP TechEd Bangalore

  1. To be able to participate, you need to be an attendee at SAP TechEd Bangalore.
  2. You need to have experience with using the product for which you‚Äôd like to participate in a Usability Test.

What you need to know about the registration process

  1. We use the Bookings app to manage registrations for Usability Tests at SAP TechEd. Your data will be stored in our forms on the booking platform. To the extent that the entered information is personal data, the data collected through this form will be used solely for the purpose of organizing and managing the event. In accordance with GDPR requirements, your data will be deleted immediately after the event concludes.
  2. Use the links below to register for the Usability Test Stations at SAP TechEd Bangalore and pick one of the available time slots for the test session.
    Please arrive at the Usability Test Lab (HALL 5) 10 minutes before your scheduled time.
  3. Please sign up with your business email address ‚Äì it will only be used for scheduling your test session; you will not receive marketing because of this registration.
  4. Email notifications will be sent from Usability Testing Lab Participant Interest Form <UsabilityTestingLabRegistration@sap.onmicrosoft.com>  Please check your SPAM/JUNK folder in case you do not receive the confirmation emails.
  5. Interested in future online user research opportunities after SAP TechEd?
    To receive invitations, please complete the registration form for the SAP User Research Panel.

Usability Test Stations

Usability Test Station 1: 
Integration Flow generation using AI & Groovy scripts, readiness for software upgrade 


Test the AI feature for creating integration flows from scenario descriptions (including Groovy script steps) with error handling. Evaluate Groovy script readiness for the upcoming Integration Cell runtime and explore integration flow creation via Joule using high-fidelity prototypes.

Target audience: Participation in this usability test is restricted to users of SAP Integration Suite who have experience with developing integration flows.

Potential roles include:

  • Integration Developers
  • Solution Architects,
  • SAP BTP Consultants
  • Business Process Experts 

Register here as a tester

 

Usability Test Station 2: 
Test Conditional Task Chains and Port Connections in SAP Datasphere, BDC

We‚Äôre inviting experienced SAP Datasphere Modelers and Integrators to participate in a usability testing session for the enhanced Task Chain workflow.

This session focuses on evaluating the new ability to react to task outcomes and define conditional execution paths using dedicated ports:

  • Success (green)
  • Error (red)
  • Any (blue)

These enhancements aim to give users greater control and flexibility in orchestrating complex workflows. Alongside these, participants will also explore other new capabilities introduced to improve error handling and configurability.

A key focus of this session is to assess both usability and the durability of interactions ‚Äî ensuring that the experience remains stable, intuitive, and efficient across varied use cases.

Your feedback will help us refine and improve our workflows even further.

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • SAP Datasphere Modeler / Integrator
  • Consultants
  • Developers

Register here as a tester


Usability Test Station 3: 
End-to-End Agentic User Journey for Building Processes with Joule

In this session, participants will experience and evaluate a future-state, agentic user journey for building business processes using Joule, the AI assistant integrated within SAP Build Process Automation. The focus is on exploring how Joule can support users through end-to-end process creation by providing intelligent suggestions, automating repetitive steps, and enabling seamless collaboration with key stakeholders. We aim to understand usability, clarity of guidance, efficiency gains, and how well Joule integrates into existing SAP Build Process Automation workflows. Participant feedback will help refine the interaction model and identify opportunities for enhancing agentic assistance in real scenarios. 

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Regular SAP Build Process Automation users
  • Process Designers
  • Citizen Developers
  • Automation Leads
  • Consultants
  • Business Process Experts

Register here as a tester

Usability Test Station 4: 
Smart Helper - An agent you define; actions you approve; Easy Fill: Copy, Paste, and Done in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

This session aims to evaluate the user experience and effectiveness of two AI-powered capabilities: Smart helper- we will evaluate how easy it is to get started, how clear control and approvals feel, and how overall usability and user experience are perceived; Easy Fill - we will evaluate how easy it is to use and if there is something missing. 

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Business Process Experts
  • Solution Architects
  • IT Administrators
  • SAP S/4HANA Solution Consultants
  • Developers

Register here as a tester


Usability Test Station 5: 
Evaluate WalkMe Onboarding Experience on SAP SuccessFactors

Evaluate how users access WalkMe tours and engage with the onboarding experience for SuccessFactors features. To evaluate how effectively users can complete key SAP SuccessFactors tasks using WalkMe tours by identifying any usability, clarity, or content issues and gathering feedback to improve the overall experience.

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Business Process Experts
  • Solution Architects
  • IT Administrators
  • SAP SuccessFactors Solution Consultants

Register here as a tester

Usability Test Station 6: 
Supercharge your SAP Fiori elements app development with SAP Fiori tools and AI

SAP Fiori tools are evolving to allow companies to dramatically improve developer efficiency by integrating intelligent, AI-enabled features and editors into the development environment. SAP Fiori tools are designed to lower the entry barrier for new teams while providing the advanced capabilities and flexibility that experienced developers demand. In this usability session, you can experiment with some of our early AI-driven features, provide feedback on our tools and our vision, and directly influence our direction for the next generation of intelligent development tools.

Target audience:
Participation in this usability test is restricted to users with experience developing Fiori apps using SAP Fiori tools (which are a part of SAP Build Code). Potential roles include:

  • S/4HANA Developers
  • Web Developers
  • Fiori Developers
  • Fiori Elements Developers
  • SAP Developers
  • Product Owners
  • Users of the Annotation Modeler
  • Other front-end developers leveraging web technologies

Register here as a tester


Disclaimer (for SAP TechEd 2025, Bangalore usability testing interest list)
By registering you are expressing interest to join the participant list for usability testing at SAP TechEd 2025, Bangalore. Registration does not guarantee participation. Selected participants will be notified separately by email once they meet all eligibility criteria required to take part in the sessions and provide feedback. Due to limited seats, we cannot accommodate all registrants; priority will be given to applicants who meet specific selection criteria (for example: product experience, implementation involvement, end-user knowledge, valid licensing status, and other program requirements).

entry.title: Develop Full-Stack ABAP Applications in SAP Business Application Studio
entry.content:
The SAP Business Application Studio provides several extensions designed to streamline the development of business applications for the SAP Intelligent Enterprise.

Among these extensions is the CDS Graphical Modeler, which enables SAP business developers to visually design Core Data Service (CDS) models. Previously, this extension was available for SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) development projects.

However, with the release of SAP BTP ABAP environment 2508 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, corresponding to ABAP release 9.16, we have integrated the CDS Graphical Modeler with ABAP. This integration allows developers to create ABAP projects using the CDS Graphical Modeler to conveniently design ABAP-compliant CDS models for various scenarios in a remote ABAP system.

Ultimately, you can now build full-stack ABAP applications in SAP Business Application Studio. Once you've created an ABAP project, you can model business objects, generate ABAP CDS artifacts, integrate a user interface, and deploy your application to the appropriate environments, such as SAP BTP ABAP environment or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Curious how this works? Check out our documentation on SAP Help Portal for detailed instructions: Develop Full-Stack ABAP Applications in SAP Business Application Studio.

But you‚Äôre short on time or just looking for a quick peek? Keep reading! üòâ

1. Set Up Your Full-Stack ABAP Project:

In the SAP Build Lobby, choose Create right above the project list and select Create from the drop-down menu. This opens the Create Project dialog.

Project creation screen with options for Application, Automated Process, and Business Site, highlighting Application with a "Next" button.

In the Create Project dialog, select Application, click Next, select Full-Stack, advance with Next, and finally select Full-Stack ABAP (SAP Business Application Studio).

"Full-Stack ABAP (SAP Business Application Studio)" option is selected for creating a project with a "Next" button available.

Advance with Next and specify the target ABAP system and configure the project details.
Once the project is created, a Core Schema Notation Model is created in the remote ABAP system, and the remote ABAP package path is added to the workspace. The project then opens in the Storyboard.

2. Model Your Application:

From the Storyboard, you can model your ABAP application using the CDS Graphical Modeler to define and visualize your ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP) business objects, projections, and services relevant to your application development.

Storyboard offers options to create a business object, projection, service, or UI application with corresponding plus buttons.

 Choose + in the Create an entity field to add the business object entities and define their relationship for the business service.

Note: Next to the Business Object modeler, you see your CSN file. This file resides on your ABAP system in the package you created previously. This file is used by the modeler to store your model. You should not edit this file manually since this can damage the integrity of the model.

Proceed with adding projections to specify which elements of a business object are exposed in the business service.

Add a business service and select which entities to expose in the service.

Storyboard shows the relation of business objects, projections, and services and an option to create a new UI application.

You are now all set to generate the ABAP backend artefacts from the modeled business objects, projections, and services. Close the Business Services modeler and return to the Storyboard.

3. Generate ABAP CDS Artifacts:

Once you have modeled your ABAP application, you need to generate the ABAP development objects based on the data model created with the CDS Graphical Modeler, including DDIC tables, CDS views, metadata extensions, and service definitions.

From the Storyboard, choose Generate and follow the steps in the wizard to perform validation checks and complete the generation process.
As a result, a read-only RAP OData UI service is generated and available in the service catalog. On the ABAP side, the development objects are activated, and the service binding is published.

4. Add a User Interface and Deploy Your Application:

As a last step, you need to create a user interface for your RAP service by generating a SAP Fiori UI application that you can then deploy to an appropriate environment, such as SAP BTP ABAP Environment or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

From the Storyboard, choose + in the UI Applications field to open the SAP Fiori Generator wizard and provide the required inputs for your UI development. To deploy the application, choose Deploy from the Application Information tab.

 

And that's it! You've successfully developed a full-stack ABAP application in SAP Business Application Studio‚Äîquickly and effortlessly in just a few steps.

What do you think of it? We would love to hear your thoughts! Share your feedback in the comments below.

entry.title: SAP Build introducing intent-based development for Application Development @ SAP TechED
entry.content:
Last week was truly memorable. After a few years away, I had the privilege of attending SAP TechEd in person again, this time in Berlin. Bringing together customers, partners, and SAP colleagues under one roof‚Äîthe iconic Berlin Messe‚Äîfor three days was a unique opportunity to both share knowledge and learn from others.

The experience began on Monday with registration. Witnessing the final preparations for the show floor, I could already sense the energy and excitement that would ignite the next day.

The following morning, as I arrived and saw the long queues, I felt grateful to be part of a company that impacts so many professionals, providing a fertile environment where technology can drive meaningful business change.

TechEd day 1

My first session with Ole Lilenthal was scheduled for 12:30 PM. I quickly realized it would be presented both on-site in the main hall and broadcast live to thousands around the world.

Presenting in the main hall

Same session online

My stress level rose, but with solid preparation, I was confident in our message: ‚ÄúExtending SAP S/4HANA with SAP Build on SAP BTP has never been easier. Now, with generative AI, it‚Äôs even more accessible.‚Äù Announcing intenet-based development with SAP Build gave me the chance to introduce Vibe Coding. While many attendees were only just beginning to explore this concept, it was clear that although most had heard of generative AI‚Äôs promise, they weren‚Äôt yet familiar with its foundational pillars. We devoted significant time during and after the session to explain these concepts in depth.

 

Later that day, the keynote by Muhammad Alam, Dr. Michael Ameling, and Dr. Philip Herzig took place. Many exciting announcements centered on AI across various domains, especially SAP. An impressive on-stage demo of Vibe Coding with SAP Build by Friederike Marby showcased the dedication‚Äîthanks to Eric Solberg‚Äôs hard work‚Äîin making it a reality. These advancements set the stage perfectly for my upcoming sessions.

The evening concluded with a lively get-together in the main hall‚Äîa fitting end to the first day. Connecting with colleagues and reflecting on the day‚Äôs events helped clarify several questions and deepen our shared understanding.

The next day promised to be packed. Ole and I started again at 12:00 PM, that session focused on presenting the strategy for how AI is reshaping application development. We complemented our session with in-depth CAP demos, demonstrating how technology and AI can come together to serve real business needs.

Second session in the main hall

 

The session was so popular (see above) that a few participants approached us afterward with questions, including an ISV provider in the AI space. He shared valuable insights, noting that SAP‚Äôs innovations in application development are impressive and that many customers don‚Äôt yet realize the full extent of SAP‚Äôs capabilities. Once they do, he believes they‚Äôll unlock AI‚Äôs potential to significantly reduce development costs. I was thrilled‚Äîthis was exactly the message I hoped to convey. We exchanged details and committed to continuing the conversation with our teams.

 

In the afternoon, my next session was with Tim Back: an in-depth exploration of ‚ÄúSAP Joule for Developers: How AI Can Boost Your Development in SAP Build.‚Äù Tim delivered a comprehensive demo of both Joule for developers and new intent-based development features in SAP Build Web Studio, highlighting the latest Vibe Coding capabilities.

Tim and I just before session started

I opened the session by emphasizing that while this isn‚Äôt yet a bulletproof generative AI process, SAP is striving to make it Relevant, Reliable, and Responsible.

The day wrapped up with a celebratory dinner alongside all the SAP Build PMs‚Äîa wonderful way to mark the event‚Äôs success!

The final day focused on tying up loose ends and attending sessions led by colleagues. All in all, I had the incredible opportunity to attend SAP TechEd as a speaker. I‚Äôm truly grateful for the experience and already looking forward to the next one. Participating as a presenter at one of the premier technology conferences in the SAP ecosystem was both an honor and a challenge, leaving me inspired, enriched, and deeply connected to the community.

If you would like to try out our new SAP Build Joule for Developer together with some vibe coding capabilities, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to me.     

Here are some links in case you would like to watch the sessions:

  • Future of Application Development in SAP Build
  • A shift towards AI-assisted developer-centric tool in SAP Build

Thank you, SAP TechEd, for an unforgettable experience. See you at the next event!

entry.title: Joule Studio for SAP Business One Customers and Partners
entry.content:
Hello everyone

We are living in fascinating times, AI is showing us a new path, and this blog aims to guide you in incorporating Joule into your SAP Business One options.

What are the requirements for using Joule?

1) You need a Joule Base license, which is free and can be obtained here: Joule Base princing 

2) You also need a Developer license for SAP Build (cloud TDD SAP Build developer 8019951), which can be obtained here: SAP Build pricing 

3) Finally, you require a Runtime license for SAP Build (cloud TDD SAP Build runtime 8019913), which can be obtained from the same link as in point 2.

13/11/2025 - Important update: I've verified that Partners can use SAP Build under the Pay-As-You-Go business model for testing, demos, and development. The Discovery Center indicates that it's free up to a certain number of users and usage.

Discovery Center 

Conclusion: Use this Pay-As-You-Go item for SAP BTP for cloud TDD (8009282).

If you have any questions, please consult your Channel Manager.

This is the first step, whether you are an SAP Customer or Partner, you must subscribe to these services, I recommend following this order:

First, subscribe to one Developer license and one Runtime license (Capacity Units). This is sufficient to get started.

This activates the creation of your SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account. You will receive a welcome email when it is ready.

Then, after receiving the SAP BTP welcome email, proceed to subscribe to the Joule Base license.

In short, the process is as follows:

At this point, you should already have all the necessary licenses to build your first projects with Joule Studio.

In an upcoming blog post, I'll explain how to configure your SAP BTP Global Account so you can then start using Joule Studio.

Best regards,

Erick G√≥mez
